column4: hey guys, ive got what seems to be a major network problem. whenever i try to apt-get something, i get a cannot find archive.ubuntu.com, but when i ping it, its there, and then apt-get works. then whenever i try to connect to irc in xchat, i have to ping irc.freenode.net first, otherwise it sees irc.freenode.net as 1.0.0.0
u have dns problem
any idea how to fix it? i figured thats what it was
echo "nameserver wuteveruhave" >> /etc/resolv.conf
if ur on router is probably the same as ur router gateway
so i just put my router ip in quotes?
yeah
just replace wuteveruhave with router ip
just tried it with sudo and i get a permission denied
interesting can u nano or vi it?
and see wut it has?
yeah, there was the ip for my router and some random ip that i have never seen before in there for nameserver
well thats ur problem change it back
can u?
im not too familair with ubuntu
sudo ?
i forgot how to get real root
u mite have to do ddat
ok, i did, and now apt-get update is still lookin at 1.0.0.0
sorri i dono then
to get reall root you have to sudo passwd root, then put in the password
well thanks tho
can u broswe webpage now?
yeah, i can browse all day and night, but connecting to irc and apt-get repo's gets hung up
